metadata.dc:title: Synergy between ajoene and ketoconazole in isolates of Microsporum canis. A preliminary study using fractional inhibitory concentration technique (FIC)
metadata.dc:description: Fungal infections are probably the most frequent infectious diseases affectinghuman being. Resistance to different anti-fungal drugs, and their bioavailabilityin the infection site, represent a problem for treatment. Looking for effectivesolutions, combination of two or more antifungal drugs to obtain an additiveeffect or synergic effect that potent antifungal activity has been investigated.In this study, the effect (additive, antagonist or synergistic) of ajoene andketoconazole combination was evaluated in the growth and proliferation offilamentous fungi. Interactions in vitro were investigated in three isolates ofMicrosporum canis through a preliminary study using micro dilution, accordingto recommendations of NCCLS M-38A, with several modifications. Resultsobtained for CIF of each isolates studied (CIF = 0,18 - 0,36 ¦ÌM), demonstratethat exists a very potent synergistic effect, when they are combined, and itrepresents a hope for future clinic trials to treat resilient fungal infectionscaused by M. canis(AU)
